qas.question: What type of carrier is the largest?
What capability does a fleet carrier offer?
What purpose were excort carriers developed for?

answers.text: to provide defense for convoys of ships

qas.question: What were most escort carriers built from?
What are the soviet aircraft carriers used by Russia actually called?
What type of carrier is the smallest?
What capability does a fleet carrier not offer?

plausible_answers.text: provide defense for convoys of ships

qas.question: What purpose were export carriers developed for?
What were few escort carriers built from?
What are the soviet aircraft carriers used by Germany actually called?

context: A <a0_0><b5_0>fleet carrier<b5_0/><a0_0/> is intended to operate with the main fleet and usually provides an <a1_0><b6_0>offensive<b6_0/><a1_0/> capability. These are the largest carriers capable of fast speeds. By comparison, escort carriers were developed <a2_0>to <b7_0>provide defense for convoys of ships<b7_0/><a2_0/>. They were smaller and slower with lower numbers of aircraft carried. Most were built from <a3_0><b8_0>mercantile hulls<b8_0/><a3_0/> or, in the case of merchant aircraft carriers, were bulk cargo ships with a flight deck added on top. Light aircraft carriers were carriers that were fast enough to operate with the fleet but of smaller size with reduced aircraft capacity. Soviet aircraft carriers now in use by Russia are actually called <a4_0><b9_0>heavy aviation cruisers<b9_0/><a4_0/>, these ships while sized in the range of large fleet carriers were designed to deploy alone or with escorts and provide both strong defensive weaponry and heavy offensive missiles equivalent to a guided missile cruiser in addition to supporting fighters and helicopters.
